clues.text: Admitted to the union in 1876, it's appropriately "the Centennial state"
Meant to distinguish Alabama from the rest of the South, it went on the state's license plates in 1955
"The Panhandle State", it has 2--the eastern one is home to Harpers Ferry & in the northern one, you'll find a huge teapot
Florida is "The Sunshine State"; Oregon is this, also starting with "Sun"--it's often amazing at Ecola State Park
"The Beef State", it's home to more cattle than people, with its 6 million cows outnumbering humans 3 to 1
Coach Rivers in the NBA or young Ms. McStuffins in animation
It preceded Cat for a meme-orable feline who had the "Worst Christmas ever"
Having rhinitis or taking snuff will make you this
Aw shucks, I don't want to draw any attention to myself, but I'll tell you it's the longest dwarf name
In a Hemingway short story title, it described the short life of Francis Macomber
What's been called the oldest type of this makeup is a 4,000-year-old "tube" in Iran that contains bright red hematite
Also called blush, this type of makeup with a French name was made using red beet juice in the Victorian era
Lead was originally an ingredient in the white foundation called oshiroi used by these women whose apprentices are called maiko
During the time of Marie Antoinette, faux beauty marks concealed blemishes caused by this disease aka Variola major
Used in ancient Egypt, this 4-letter makeup that darkens the edges of the eyes comes to English from Arabic
Beginning in the '60s, it was "Choosy mothers choose" this brand of peanut butter; in the '80s, "Choosy moms"
Products from Udi's famously lack this, per its logo
Introduced in the 1920s, this Japanese mayo brand was named for a novelty doll popular around the world
To honor its co-founder, Dreyer's ice cream goes by this name east of the Rockies
This flour brand got its name in 1896 & a new logo, a wheat crown, in 2020

clues.text: In 1999 this Spanglish-titled tune topped the charts for 5 weeks

clues.text: A good deal at a low price; The Who sang of "the best I ever had"

If your liver isn't adequately processing this pigment, leading to Gilbert syndrome, just know it's utterly harmless
"By the Shores of Silver Lake" is the fifth book in this series about pioneer life
"Before Night Falls" is Reinaldo Arenas' memoir describing his life as a gay man persecuted in this country
It's the title of Demi Moore's memoir; Bruce Willis & Ashton Kutcher are characters, but not  Joy, Anger, Sadness or Bing Bong

It's a German noun referring to a trashy work of art, yet one that some can't help but love
Brazilian star Anitta recalled "playing in the streets" in this type of informal settlement in Rio

James Jones' "From Here to Eternity" tells of peacetime military members serving in what's now this state
